#Text=Wikinews Shorts : August 10 , 2009
#Text=A compilation of brief news reports for Monday , August 10 , 2009 .
#Text=English Badminton team withdraw from World Championship because of terror threat

#Text=After what has been described as a " specific terrorist threat " , the English national badminton team has withdrawn from the Badminton World Championship currently being held in Hyderabad , India .

column1: #Text=The threat is believed to be linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba , a Kashmiri group linked to the attack on Mumbai in 2008 .
#Text=V.K. Verma president of the Badminton Association of India dismissed the " terror threats " as rumors spread by the media .

column1: #Text=The Welsh and Scottish teams will continue to compete in the tournament , with Anne Smillie chief executive of Badminton Scotland saying that the English team had " perhaps overreacted " .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" England pull out of badminton tournament after terror threat " — The Guardian , August 9 , 2009

column1: #Text=Nagasaki holds ceremony
#Text=on 64th anniversary of atomic bombing
#Text=A ceremony was held in Nagasaki , Japan on Sunday to commemorate the 64th anniversary of the atomic bombing of the city in World War II .
#Text=Speaking to an audience of 5000 the mayor of the city called for worldwide nuclear disarmament .
#Text=In his speech Prime Minister Taro Aso again reiterated that Japan would never produce , possess or allow nuclear weapons on its soil .
#Text=A similar ceremony was attended by 50,000 in Hiroshima on Thursday .
#Text=Sources
#Text=Wang Hongjiang .
#Text=" Japan marks 64th anniversary of Nagasaki atomic bombing " — Xinhua News Agency , August 9 , 2009
#Text=" Nagasaki calls on leaders to visit atomic bomb site " — Agence France-Presse , August 9 , 2009
#Text=British soldier killed in Afghanistan
#Text=A British soldier of 2nd Battalion The Mercian Regiment has been killed by an IED whilst on patrol in Gereshk in Helmand Province , Afghanistan .
#Text=The death brings the number to five , the number of British soldiers killed in Afghanistan in this month alone and 196 since 2001 , when British troops arrived in Afghanistan .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" British soldier killed in Afghanistan blast " — Agence France-Presse , August 9 , 2009
#Text=" UK soldier killed in Afghanistan " — BBC Online , August 9 , 2009
#Text=British contractor in Iraq faces death penalty for murder
#Text=A British contractor working for a private security company in Iraq has been arrested for the murder of two colleagues in Iraq .
#Text=ArmorGroup Iraq confirms that two of its employees , a Briton and an Australian , have been killed in a firearms incident .
#Text=The gunman is now in the custody of the Iraqi authorities and faces a charge of premeditated murder , a crime for which he may hang .
#Text=Sources
#Text=Gamel , Kim .
#Text=" Briton in Iraqi custody after contractor killings " — Associated Press , August 9 , 2009
#Text=Yan .
#Text=" Iraq arrests Briton for murder charges " — Xinhua News Agency , August 9 , 2009
#Text=Former British child actor claims to be father of Michael Jackson 's daughter
#Text=Former child actor Mark Lester , best known for playing the title role in the 1968 film Oliver ! , claims to be the father of Michael Jackson 's daughter Paris .
#Text=Talking to British tabloid the News Of The World , Lester claims that Jackson asked him for a donation of sperm in the mid 90s and points to the resemblance between his own daughter and Paris .
#Text=Lester claims to be motivated by the desire to remain in contact with Paris , which he fears may be denied him by Katherine Jackson , Paris ' guardian .
#Text=His claim is supported by Uri Geller , a friend of both Jackson and Mark Lester , who said " I am not surprised , I knew it all along simply because Michael told me .

column1: #Text=" Oliver ! actor claims he fathered Jackson 's daughter " — Agence France-Presse , August 9,2009
#Text=Three bombs explode in Majorca
#Text=Three bombs have exploded on the Spanish holiday island of Majorca on Sunday .
#Text=Targeted at tourism sites
#Text=all the devices were small and there have been no injuries .
#Text=Basque separatist group ETA has claimed responsibility for the attacks which follow a car bomb that killed two Civil Guard officers 10 days ago on the Mediterranean island .
#Text=ETA 's recent bombing campaign , which has also seen bombings and deaths on the mainland , comes on the 50th anniversary of the founding of the organisation .
#Text=Sources
#Text=Tobey , Paul .
#Text=" Three Bombs Explode in Mallorca ; No Injuries Reported " — Bloomberg.com , August 9 , 2009
#Text=" Bomb blasts hit Spain 's Majorca " — BBC Online , August 9,2009
